These days, Ho Chi Minh City is
constantly immersed in classrooms.  The misty,
milky air lasts from morning until
noon, sometimes even in the afternoon. According to
experts, this is a mixed haze phenomenon
caused by fog combined with dry haze, causing an
air pollution index warning at a low
level.
Ho Chi Minh City is in the
dry season, but the air humidity is still quite high. The
mixed season, which occurs during
hot weather, has caused a feeling of stuffiness and discomfort
for many people today whose bones are a little cold.
It's like
air pollution, it's not very fresh, it
affects my vision.
Many causes of mixed compensation are
because in the lower air there are
suspended substances from car fumes and dust from cars.
Construction traffic activities cause air pollution.
Monitoring indicators show that
suspended fine dust in the city has exceeded standards,
even on some days it is in the top 10
most air polluted cities in the
world.  At the end of the year,
traffic density increases more than usual, which
is one reason why during the
last months of the year, pollution often
increases.
Hazy air pollution is forecast to last
until the end of the year.  Closer to Tet, to prevent respiratory diseases,
people should wear masks when going out to
clean their home environment, clean their
nose and throat, and eat enough nutritious food to
increase their resistance.

Recently, French officials said that
Notre Dame de Paris may be able to reopen in time to
welcome tourists by the end of 2024.
This church is being rebuilt after
a large fire destroyed the roof in
October
2019 according to  The head of the bell tower project
that collapsed in the fire will

a signal of the strong revival of the
Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris. After more than two years of
restructuring the old foundation to  ensuring

began last year, including the
reconstruction of the 93 m high tower built
in the 19th century to mark the
completion of an important restoration phase
of the project.  A tree branch project was placed on
top of the bell tower amid cheers and
applause from the architects and
workers, so that the church's reopening in
December 2024 is in line with the goal set
by President Emmanuel Macron.

The world of maritime and Antarctic research
in Australia has just successfully hatched 21
red hand fish. This is a new success
in the breeding program to preserve the
precious fish species that is at risk of
extinction in the land of kangaroos but beyond.  In order to
successfully hatch and raise them,
scientists still have a bigger thing to do:
restore and protect
their habitat in the
wild. All 21 of these giant fish account for 25
minutes, or nearly 100 fish.  red fish still exist
in nature on earth,
so the successful hatching of these fish
has special meaning. This is the second time
we have been able to breed this species
in captivity, it will take 2
years.  To grow up and need to learn how to
survive in the wild, these fish are only
8 mm long and experts have to
gradually get them used to natural conditions.
This is like teaching children
to be smart when going out.  We
slowly increase the complexity of the
habitat and then add
other species that are likely to be encountered in the
wild. When the fish have grown large, they will be
released into the wild. The next task is to
manage the fish.  Manage and protect natural habitats
to increase the survival rate of red-handed fish.
Currently, red-handed fish only appear in
two locations in the Tasman,
where over-hunting of rock lobsters
has caused sea urchins to skyrocket.
